availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Fitchpatrick (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary B. Adams Fitzpatrick on February 28, 1858. Father of Sarah Ann Fitzpatrick, Walter Fitzpatrick, and Cynthia Fitzpatrick. Resident in Floyd County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as a private from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 454B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 21.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 3.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001912950, p. 168.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894-895.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Fitzpatrick (1835-1887)," Memorial #172701095, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/172701095# (accessed October 4, 2018).
